sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Motors drive your robot's movement. In FRC, you will primarily use motor controllers from CTRE (Talon FX) and REV (SPARK MAX). This lesson covers creating and controlling these motors in Robot.java.

sections.title: Objectives
sections.subtitle: You will learn to:
items: Work with CTRE and REV hardware.

sections.title: Robot.java Lifecycle
sections.content:
robotInit(): Runs once at startup. Create your motors here.
teleopPeriodic(): Runs repeatedly during driver control. Update motor outputs here.

sections.title: CTRE: Talon FX
sections.content: The Talon FX is a high-performance motor controller with a built-in encoder. It requires the CTRE Phoenix 6 library.

sections.title: Talon FX Example
REV: SPARK MAX
sections.content: The SPARK MAX supports both brushless (NEO) and brushed motors. It requires the REVLib library.

sections.title: SPARK MAX Example
Control Basics
sections.content:
Speed: Values range from -1.0 (full reverse) to 1.0 (full forward). 0.0 stops the motor.
Multiple Motors: Create separate instances for each motor (e.g., left and right drive motors).
